steps.text: Wash and soak 1 cup of rice and 1/2 cup of toor dal in water for 30 minutes.
In a pressure cooker, heat 2 tablespoons of ghee or oil.
Add 1 teaspoon of mustard seeds and let them splutter.
Add 1 teaspoon of cumin seeds, 1 teaspoon of urad dal, and a pinch of asafoetida. Saute until the dal turns golden brown.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 chopped green chilies, and a few curry leaves. Saute until the onion turns translucent.
Add 1 chopped tomato and cook until it becomes soft and mushy.
Add 1/4 teaspoon of turmeric powder, 1/2 teaspoon of red chili powder, and 1/2 teaspoon of sambar powder. Mix well.
Drain the soaked rice and dal, and add them to the pressure cooker. Mix well with the masala.
Add 3 cups of water, salt to taste, and close the pressure cooker lid.
Pressure cook for 3 whistles on medium heat. Let the pressure release naturally before opening the cooker. Serve hot with raita or pickle.
